summary: An internal FBI email from August 6, 2019, discussing the planning and logistics for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas. The email coordinates the travel and timing for FBI agents from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Task Force.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The search warrant is being drafted for his private island off St. Thomas as part of an investigation.

events.title: Search warrant affidavit drafting for Epstein's island
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is drafting a search warrant affidavit for Epstein's private island off St. Thomas, with the warrant expected to be sworn out on Friday.

events.title: Planned FBI travel to St. Thomas
events.description: FBI agents from the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Task Force plan to fly out on the FBI Q400 plane to St. Thomas to execute the search warrant.

events.title: Expected search of Epstein's island
events.description: The search of Epstein's island, managed by the Evidence Response Team (ERT), is expected to take 1-3 days.

events.title: Planned FBI travel home
events.description: Thursday is planned as the travel day home for the FBI agents after the search operation.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively drafting a search warrant affidavit for Jeffrey Epstein's private island off St. Thomas in August 2019.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking Task Force in New York was directly involved in planning and executing the search warrant operation.
The search operation was planned to be conducted by the FBI's Evidence Response Team (ERT) and was expected to last 1-3 days.
The FBI planned to use its own aircraft (an FBI Q400 plane) to transport agents to and from St. Thomas for the operation.
The email demonstrates coordinated, high-level planning between the SDNY and the FBI for a significant investigative action against Epstein's assets shortly after his arrest.
